text: Any pseudo code for ev?

elements.text: Any pseudo code for ev?

text: Here is 100% match, this is telling me that maybe I am the problem / the market doesn't have the capacity it once did

elements.text: Here is 100% match, this is telling me that maybe I am the problem / the market doesn't have the capacity it once did

text:
`ev=lambda x: (1.0 - x.implied_probability) * <http://x.sm|x.sm> - x.implied_probability * <http://x.sm|x.sm> * (x.priceMatched - 1.0)`

sm is size matched - work out the delta if it's a delayed fill
implied_probability is the probability implied by the market book X seconds after the fill
priceMatched is obvious but maybe you need to do something funky if you got matched at different prices on different fills

elements.text: ev=lambda x: (1.0 - x.implied_probability) *
x.sm
- x.implied_probability *
x.sm
* (x.priceMatched - 1.0)

implied_probability is the probability implied by the market book X seconds after the fill

text: Pretty much all my inplay GPS based strats have been down significantly on last year performance. Still making enough to dodge returning to employment but its getting close enough that I have to keep thinking about it. I don't know how I would go about testing it but it 'feels' like the inplay market is sharpening up a bit with fewer opportunities.

elements.text: Pretty much all my inplay GPS based strats have been down significantly on last year performance. Still making enough to dodge returning to employment but its getting close enough that I have to keep thinking about it. I don't know how I would go about testing it but it 'feels' like the inplay market is sharpening up a bit with fewer opportunities.

text: I am down 20% this year across the board but then I have probably spent 50% less time on it (maybe less tbh)

elements.text: I am down 20% this year across the board but then I have probably spent 50% less time on it (maybe less tbh)

text: After some analysis I worked out that for 2 months I was causing self-inflicted damage so its hard to work out what profit would be without that. I've a small sample size to play with though as I only have 2.5 years of profitability to go on. Was last year very good, was this year very bad or is the market just getting more efficient? I've no idea where to start to answer that question.

text: Just going back to your earlier point about less size being matched, could it be anything more complex than a drop in discretionary spending due to increased fixed living costs (hence betfair volumes are down amongst recreational punters and a higher proportion of those remaining are more likely to only take/offer value prices)?

elements.text: Just going back to your earlier point about less size being matched, could it be anything more complex than a drop in discretionary spending due to increased fixed living costs (hence betfair volumes are down amongst recreational punters and a higher proportion of those remaining are more likely to only take/offer value prices)?

text: <@UQL0QDEKA> Not sure that Betangel will make that large a difference other than to TPD profits - TPD purchased betmover way before TPD was available via betangel. Even though BA has automation, because of the nature of that application and its focus on user interface, I doubt that anyone here using their own automated rollout is getting beaten to prices by BA automation.

elements.text: Not sure that Betangel will make that large a difference other than to TPD profits - TPD purchased betmover way before TPD was available via betangel. Even though BA has automation, because of the nature of that application and its focus on user interface, I doubt that anyone here using their own automated rollout is getting beaten to prices by BA automation.

text: Yes what I mean by the reference to betangel was that there would be a number of uses using it that needed to get up to speed so there may have been som easier profits available initially. I have the TPD feed via betfair (using c#) and i also tested using betangel. I got different results using the same strategy criteria using my own program and betangel. Your correct about the frequency of the updates by the way.

text:
Isn't this inevitable? Knowledge improves, software gets better, methodologies get refined and in the face of economic circumstances there's a smaller pie cut into smaller sizes. 

I've seen similar clear kinks in the charts, some good some bad but it's impossible to know what's going on when there's so many participants doing so many different things which all interact.   

If you want to return to the days of easy pickings, kill betcode, shut the group and stop making it easy for people to compete with you :wink:

elements.text:

I've seen similar clear kinks in the charts, some good some bad but it's impossible to know what's going on when there's so many participants doing so many different things which all interact.   

If you want to return to the days of easy pickings, kill betcode, shut the group and stop making it easy for people to compete with you

text:
100% understand. Helping others is rewarding in itself and often triggers new ideas or at the very least the need to prove what you do is in fact sound.   

Sorry for the thread drift there, but efficiency and competition are always a problem as exchanges mature.  Stark and sudden changes are a mystery though.

text: For some added context I have been running some similar strategies since the start of this year, I have removed these and reverted some minor changes back to 2021 to test if this makes any difference to matching/profit

text:
In play horses have got tougher I think - I'm about 40% down this year compared to last (which was itself 20% down compared to the previous year) - I've started rehearsing "...and would you like fries with that ?" in case the deterioration continues

I built my own infrastructure a good while ago and, whilst I'm not saying it's down to Betcode, with every burger I serve I will be quietly repeating "Liam" under my breath in much the same way Arya Stark reads names from her list :smiley:
